entries: Your relic can absorb and release water, storing it in a endless reservoir. You either touch your relic to an adjacent body of water and absorb 1 gallon of it into the reservoir, or you release 1 gallon of a liquid from the reservoir. You can add another action to the activation to absorb water from a touched creature made entirely of water, like a water elemental. If you do, it takes {@damage 1d6} damage per relic level (basic Fortitude save).

entries.trigger: You are targeted by an {@trait acid} or {@trait water} effect
entries: Your relic attempts to {@quickref counteract|crb|3|counteracting} the effect, expending 1 gallon of stored liquid. At the GM's discretion, you can use this ability on effects made of other liquids, such as blood.
